item.title: Data Tidying Project
item.description: Introduction The data hosted at [data.world] and contains information about Sales in the US. Get Data Data Set 1: Sales from the Retail Trade and Food Services Report from the US Census. This dataset only covers Department Stores, though the report covers a wide range of retail types. item.title: Machine Learning using linear regression to predict house prices
item.description: Intro & Background Linear regression being one of the most basic and popular algorithms in machine learning, so when aspiring data scientist starts off in this field, linear regression is inevitably the first algorithm they come across. Analysis Approach You can click on the link below to see the working code in Python and reproduce it to test the strength of your own password. https://github.com/2series/100_Days_of_ML_Code/blob/master/Linear_Regression_from_Scratch.ipynb

item.title: Build A Simple Blockchain
item.description: Intro & Background Blockchain is a data structure that was first introduced by Satoshi Nakamoto in the Bitcoin protocol white paper a decade ago. Bitcoin’s blockchain stores transaction data, but we can store any type of data in a blockchain. Ethereum, for example, enables users to store code snippets called ‘smart contracts’ in their blockchain. In this project, I build a simple blockchain in Python that uses proof-of-work consensus, just like the Bitcoin protocol does.

item.title: Password Detection Strength
item.description: Intro & Background A function written that uses regular expressions to make sure the password string it is passed is strong. A strong password is defined as one that is at least eight characters long, contains both uppercase and lowercase characters, and has at least one digit. You may need to test the string against multiple regex patterns to validate its strength. Analysis Approach You can click on the link below to see the working code in Python and reproduce it to test the strength of your own password.
